text: John James "Jack" Adams (June 14, 1895 â€“ May 1, 1968) was a Canadian professional ice hockey player, coach and general manager in the National Hockey League and Pacific Coast Hockey Association. He was a Hall of Fame player during a 10 year professional career with Toronto, Vancouver and Ottawa. He is best known for his 36-year association with the Detroit Red Wings of the NHL as coach or general manager. He later became president of the Central Hockey League. ==Awards & achievements== * Won Stanley Cup as Player 1918 Toronto, 1927 Ottawa * Won Stanley Cup as Manager-Coach 1936-37-43 with Detroit * Won Stanley Cup as Manager 1950-52-54-55 with Detroit *Named in his honour, the Jack Adams Award was introduced in 1974 and is awarded annually to the most outstanding coach in the NHL. *Lester Patrick Trophy in 1966. *Inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame in 1959. *First All-Star Team Coach in 1937 & 1943\. *Second All-Star Team Coach in 1945. ==Related pages== *List of NHL seasons *List of NHL players ==References== * ==Other websites== * Category:1895 births Category:1968 deaths Category:Canadian ice hockey coaches Category:Canadian ice hockey centres Category:Hockey Hall of Fame inductees Category:Ice hockey people from Ontario Category:Ottawa Senators (original) players Category:Sportspeople from Thunder Bay Category:Toronto Arenas players Category:Toronto St. Pats players
title: Jack Adams
